title: Shelter from the blizzard March 2017
text:
Due to blizzard conditions on March 14 2017, reservations were made to stay at the Gallivant Times Square located on 48th Street, and Broadway.Upon entering the room I was immediately struck by the small size of the room, the dark brown paint, and wallpaper which made the room feel even smaller.
The frigid room temperature was also very noticeable so I contacted housekeeping services and an engineer was sent up to turn on the radiator, and to adjust the thermostat.
After the heating issue was "fixed" the room turned into a sauna. No matter what temperature the thermostat was set to, it would shift to 79 degrees. The laminate flooring was warped, and there were consistent puddles of water on the floor. Water was also found leaking from the radiator. In addition, why mention free wi-fi only to charge the client on the final bill? Doesn't free imply no charge?
All-in-all the room was adequate for the purposes of shelter from the blizzard, and the location was in excellent proximity to work. On a regular basis, I would not recommend this hotel for a stay while in NYC, unless all you need is a bed, and a place to freshen up. I now truly grasp ratings of Trip Advisor south of 3.9. On a positive note, the Staff is pleasant, and attention to guest needs were immediately attended to. The hotel location is central to many sights, and attractions in midtown Manhattan
